skill.name: pdf
skill.description: Comprehensive PDF manipulation toolkit for extracting text and tables, creating new PDFs, merging/splitting documents, and handling forms. When Claude needs to fill in a PDF form or programmatically process, generate, or analyze PDF documents at scale.
skill.summary: Comprehensive PDF manipulation toolkit for extracting text and tables, creating new PDFs, merging/sp...
skill.author: anthropics

security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill from github.com/anthropics/skills repository. Contains only PDF processing scripts using established Python libraries (pypdf, pdfplumber, reportlab). No network calls, no external command execution, no sensitive filesystem access beyond specified PDF files.

content.value_statement: PDF documents require manual effort to extract data, fill forms, or combine multiple files. This skill provides programmatic tools to extract text and tables, create new PDFs, merge and split documents, and fill forms automatically using established Python libraries.
actual_capabilities: Extract text from PDF documents using pypdf and pdfplumber libraries
Extract tables from PDF documents with structure preserved
Create new PDF documents from scratch using reportlab
Merge multiple PDF files into a single document
Split PDF documents into individual pages
Fill PDF forms programmatically using field mapping
limitations: Scanned PDFs require OCR (pytesseract) and may have lower accuracy
Password-protected PDFs require password provided by user
Complex form layouts with overlapping fields may need manual review

use_cases.title: Automate form data entry
use_cases.description: Automatically fill PDF forms with data from other sources to reduce manual data entry work.

use_cases.title: Extract tables from reports
use_cases.description: Extract tabular data from PDF reports for analysis in spreadsheets or databases.

use_cases.title: Combine case documents
use_cases.description: Merge multiple PDF documents into organized case files with proper page ordering.

prompt_templates.title: Extract text
prompt_templates.scenario: Get all text from a PDF
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract all text from input.pdf and save it to output.txt using pdfplumber.

prompt_templates.title: Merge documents
prompt_templates.prompt: Merge doc1.pdf, doc2.pdf, and doc3.pdf into merged.pdf using pypdf.

prompt_templates.title: Fill form
prompt_templates.prompt: Fill the fields in form.pdf using the data from values.json. First check if the PDF has fillable fields.

prompt_templates.title: Create PDF
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new PDF report with title, table of quarterly sales data, and page numbers using reportlab.

output_examples.input: Extract the text and tables from the quarterly report PDF
output: - Table 1: Revenue by Region (4 rows x 3 columns)
- Table 2: Expenses by Category (6 rows x 3 columns)
- Table 3: Growth Metrics (5 rows x 2 columns)

output_examples.input: Create a welcome document with company letterhead and branding
output: - Added company logo and letterhead on page 1
- Added page numbers on all pages

output_examples.input: Fill out the tax form with the provided employee information
output: - Filled text fields: name, address, SSN, income
- Selected radio group option for filing status

best_practices: Use pdfplumber for text extraction as it preserves layout better than pypdf
Validate form field values before filling to catch errors early
Convert PDFs to images first when filling non-fillable forms to ensure accurate placement
anti_patterns: Do not attempt to fill complex non-fillable forms without visual analysis
Do not skip bounding box validation when placing annotations
Do not process password-protected PDFs without obtaining the password

faq.question: Which PDF libraries work with Claude and Claude Code?
faq.answer: pypdf, pdfplumber, reportlab, pypdfium2, pdf-lib (JavaScript), and pdfjs-dist work with Claude. Each has different strengths.

faq.question: What are the size limits for PDF processing?
faq.answer: Processing large PDFs with hundreds of pages may require chunked processing to manage memory effectively.

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with existing document workflows?
faq.answer: Yes. Scripts can be called from any Python code. Use the scripts directory tools as building blocks for automated pipelines.

faq.question: Is my data safe when processing PDFs?
faq.answer: All processing happens locally. Scripts read and write only specified files. No data is sent to external services.

faq.question: Why is my text extraction returning empty results?
faq.answer: Scanned PDFs contain images, not text. Use OCR with pytesseract. If encrypted, provide the password.

faq.question: How does this compare to other PDF tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides Claude-specific instructions. Tools like qpdf and pdftotext offer command-line alternatives.
